alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Coast; Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 2:54PM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Del Norte County, Humboldt County, Mendocino County, Southwest Trinity, and Northwest Lake. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 2 to 3 inches of rain have fallen along the coast with widespread flooding impacts continuing to be reported in Humboldt and Del Norte counties. The focus of rain will shift south with 1 to 1.5 inches of heavy rain forecast in Mendocino and Lake Counties this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
